answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Jenna – I hope the following is helpful.  Most city facility use policies I found include text such as “City Hall facilities shall not be used for commercial enterprise, religious organizations, conducting activities, any profit-making endeavors, or any activity not consistent with the general business purpose of the building.” But I did include one, Eden Prairie that does allow religious groups to use city facilities:
Blaine, ID
http://www.ci.blaine.mn.us/_Docs/_Administration/FacilityUsePolicy.pdf 
James City/County, VA
http://www.jamescitycountyva.gov/pdf/parksrecpdfs/Policies-all/IndoorFacilityUsePolicy.pdf 
Cottage Grove, MN
http://www.cottage-grove.org/2012-05-02-17-16-26/facility-use 
Clinton, TN
http://www.clintontn.net/usingcomcenter.htm 
Eden Prairie, MN – does allow religious groups to use city owned facilities
http://www.edenprairie.org/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=1663 
Pam

author: Jenna Hurley
text: The City of Mason is looking to get some feedback from other local municipalities on how they handle partnerships with religious organizations in the community. We have an organization that would like to run a bible study out of our community center but we are hesitant because we do not want to upset residents who may be of different religions, and also this may open the door to an influx of organizations contacting us to offer the same services inside our community center. Has any other local municipalities dealt with this issue and if so we are eager to learn how you have handled this topic.
title: partnership with religiously affilliated organizations
